question: 受領書
sourceMnemonic:
Please <kanji>accept</kanji> this <kanji>territory</kanji>. Oh, you want some <kanji>writing</kanji> to make the deal official? Okay, here's a <vocabulary>receipt</vocabulary>.

This word refers to a document which serves as proof of receiving goods, services, or money in an official setting, like a business transaction. If you’re just talking about the receipt you get while shopping, you can simply say <ja>レシート</ja> or <ja>領収書</ja>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
